definition[0]: extremely important and needing to be done or dealt with immediately
example[0]: It is imperative that politicians should be good communicators.
example[1]: It is imperative to meet face to face with the client.
note[0]: it is imperative (for somebody) to do something
definition[1]: an imperative verb is one that expresses an order, such as ‘stand up’
definition[2]: something that must be done urgently
example[2]: A broad and balanced education is an imperative for raising standards.
definition[3]: an idea or belief that has a strong influence on people, making them behave in a particular way
example[3]: Sharing food is the most important moral imperative in Semai society.
definition[4]: the form of a verb that expresses an order. For example, in the order ‘Come here’, ‘come’ is in the imperative.
